You are my wife. Out of the great love I have for you, I have chosen you as my wife and, without asking for any consideration from you, I give you the property listed below free of charge and I hereby relinquish all rights and interests I have had in the property listed below and hereby transfer all rights and interests to you. Therefore, from now on, you shall be the full owner of the property as per the schedule and shall pay all taxes to the Government and enjoy the property freely and comfortably with all the rights of donation, gift, exchange and sale as per your wish.
If any obstacles arise in the execution of the property by you, whether by me or by my subjects, by you or by your subjects, I shall be able to resolve all such disputes at my own expense and execute the property without any hindrance.
I hereby declare that the said property is undisputed, unencumber Declaration
The minimum stamp duty payable on this document under Section 41 of the Indian Stamp Duty Act is Rs.12,780/-, and registration fee of Rs.3,195/-, user charge of Rs.500/-, totaling Rs.16,475/- has been paid in State Bank of India.

Declaration of the undersigned
I/we have furnished to the undersigned all the necessary particulars including the original title deeds of the immovable property, property tax receipts, other government approvals and encumbrance certificates and my/our identity documents issued by the government. I/We hereby register and execute this deed in the name of the person to whom the Scheduled Property is registered, stating that I/We have not previously made any transfer/transfer/registration of the immovable property to which these documents relate and that no one else has any right to transfer the Scheduled Property except me/us. I/We hereby certify that all the above information is true and correct and I/We hereby undertake to take full responsibility for all legal proceedings and actions relating to such matters in the future if any of the above information is found to be false. The Sub-Registrar who registered this document, the office staff, the person who wrote and registered the document, the clerk who wrote and registered this document, and the clerk who wrote and registered the document, shall not have any relationship or responsibility in relation to this document written and registered on this day. The document will be written and registered only with the details provided by me/us. Declaration of the undersigned

I/We hereby undertake to register this deed from the undersigned.
I/We hereby undertake to be fully responsible for all transactions relating to this property.
I/We hereby confirm that all the above information is true and that if any of the above information is found to be false in the future, I/We shall be fully responsible for all legal transactions and actions related to such matters.
The Sub-Registrar who registered this document, the office staff, the person who wrote and registered the document, the clerk who wrote and registered this document, and the clerk who wrote and registered the document, shall not have any relationship or responsibility in relation to this document, which is written and registered on this day. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 423 of 2026, dated 22/Jan/2026, executed by Kodamanchili Siva, in favour of his Wife, Kodamanchili Devi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 72.6 Sq. Yds., bearing Near by Door No. 15-75, comprised in survey number 1143-2, 1144-2D, situated in Devarapalli Village, Gramapanchayt and Mandal, Erstwhile West Godavari now within the District of East Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Kovvur is bounded as follows: bNorth by: Site of Prathipati Nagalakshmi South by: Road bEast by: Road West by: Site of Tholeti Bhudevi
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
